item.title: Project Euler 6: Sum Square Difference
Project Euler 1: Multiples of 3 or 5
item.description: Problem Statement If we list all the natural numbers below 10 that are multiples of 3 or 5, we get 3, 5, 6 and 9. The sum of these multiples is 23. Find the sum of all the multiples of 3 or 5 below \(n\). My Algorithm In general, the sum of the natural numbers up to \(n\) is the $n$-th triangular number. Let’s call this \(T(n)\). A well known formula for this is
